definitions.definition: a continuous pain in the head
definitions.labels: (British English)(informal)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(British English)(British English)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(British English)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(British English)

examples.text: Red wine gives me a headache.
I have **a splitting headache** *(= a very bad one)*.
She had left the party early, pleading a headache.
The workers had complained of headaches and nausea.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that causes worry or trouble

examples.text: The real headache will be getting the bank to lend you the money.
These regulations have created major headaches for many businesses.
Uneven cash flow proved to be a big headache for the company.
